DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the outcome of the MRI or CT.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to computed tomography, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, or magnetic resonance imaging,  imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues, being performed as a method diagnostic evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Computed Tomography Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stable; subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition superior to an earlier condition.

Concepts.definition: A condition superior to an earlier condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
